data.event: In 1834, Hezekiah Brink built the first cabin in what was to become Harrisburg.

event.title: Two years later, William Kirkpatrick settled

data.event: Two years later, William Kirkpatrick settled downstream in an area that became Chatham.

event.title: 1838, the small towns of Harrisburg and Chatham combined

data.event: In 1838, the small towns of Harrisburg and Chatham combined to become the Town of Sterling in an effort to attract the county seat.

event.title: distinguished himself in the area during the Blackhawk War in 1832

data.event: The name "Sterling" was bestowed to the new town in honor of Major James Sterling, who distinguished himself in the area during the Blackhawk War in 1832.
On February 16, 1857 Sterling was incorporated as a city by state law.
